passage.text: UAG readthrough in mammalian cells: Effect of upstream and downstream stop codon contexts reveal different signals

Our findings indicate that mouse cells have different interpretations of readthrough, influenced by both upstream and downstream stop codon contexts. This implies that there are intricate interactions between the mRNA and the translation termination machinery components. When comparing our results to those of plant cells and yeast, we conclude that the recognition of stop codesons in eukaryotes is conserved.
